speaker: WOMAN ON APB WIRE
line: About your request for assistance, Fifty, what is your present location? Unit Fifty, go ahead.

speaker: OFFICER #1
line: Suspect is now westbound. Has entered the shade of the shipworks off April Street. Unit Fifty still in pursuit, over.

speaker: WOMAN ON APB WIRE
line: A roger, Unit Fifty, I copy. Be advised when you are...

speaker: OFFICER #1
line: This is the police! Pull your vehicle over and step out! Stop your vehicle. Put your hands on the roof and freeze! Hold it!

speaker: OFFICER #2
line: Get down there!

speaker: OFFICER #1
line: On the ground! Do it!

speaker: OFFICER #2
line: Did you hear me?

speaker: OFFICER #1
line: Face down! Do it!

speaker: OFFICER #2
line: Stay there! Get down!

speaker: OFFICER #4
line: Stop! Armed officer! I hit him. I know I hit him. Where the hell did he go? He'd be bleeding bad.

speaker: MAN #1
line: ...off the coast of Italy.

speaker: MAN #2
line: But, but theirs is a very light larvae.

speaker: MAN #1
line: That's exactly what stumped me. Because inside there must be something, the weight of the heaviest rock in existence.

speaker: MAN #2
line: But, professor, that... that would be Icelandic peridotite.

speaker: MAN #1
line: Precisely.

speaker: MAN #2
line: There's a piece chipped off.

speaker: MAN #1
line: By me.

speaker: MAN #2
line: Well, what, what's the rock inside?

speaker: MAN #1
line: Icelandic peridotite, naturally. When I saw this, I stopped chipping.

speaker: MAN #2
line: In a rock from Iceland?

speaker: MULDER
line: Mulder.

speaker: DEEP THROAT
line: Are you watching channel eight?

speaker: MAN #2
line: ...across the world.

speaker: MAN #1
line: What's your conclusion?

speaker: MAN #2
line: Science does not jump to conclusions. Science is not a guessing game...

speaker: FEMALE REPORTER
line: ...Shipworks, where a sixty-mile high speed car chase ended early this evening. The suspect eluded capture by leaping into the harbor but not before reportedly injuring several Ardis officers. We have Captain Roy Lacerio standing by. Captain? How was the man able to escape and how seriously injured were the officers involved?

speaker: LACERIO
line: Those details are still unclear, I'll be talking with several of the off...

speaker: MAN
line: We need you, Captain.

speaker: LACERIO
line: I'm sorry, you'll have to excuse me.

speaker: FEMALE REPORTER
line: Captain Roy Lacerio here being pulled away during an intense manhunt. Captain Roy Lacerio here being pulled away during an intense...

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, you've been through this tape a hundred times. What exactly are you hoping to find?

speaker: MULDER
line: I don't know.

speaker: SCULLY
line: And all he told you to was to watch channel eight?

speaker: MULDER
line: Yeah, that's all he said.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Do we even know why the suspect was being chased?

speaker: MULDER
line: As far as I can tell, he wouldn't pull over for a moving violation.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, that ought to put him in the Ten Most Wanted list.

speaker: MULDER
line: There's got to be something here. Some detail. Something we're not seeing.

speaker: SCULLY
line: How do you know he's not just yanking your chain, this Deep Throat character?

speaker: MULDER
line: Why would he do that?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, he has lied to you by his own admission.

speaker: MULDER
line: I don't think he'd call if there wasn't something here... something I was supposed to see. Something he wants me to see.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Then what are you missing?

speaker: LACERIO
line: Well, I don't know if you were aware but there were three different law enforcement agencies out here last night.

speaker: MULDER
line: Hunting a man on a moving violation?

speaker: LACERIO
line: I know it's not "Silence of the Lambs," but it's what we do.

speaker: MULDER
line: The man in the photograph doesn't appear to be wearing a badge or a uniform. He's not one of yours?

speaker: LACERIO
line: No, sir. But like I said, it was a zoo out here.

speaker: MULDER
line: You say the suspect was shot. Any explanation why the body hasn't been recovered?

speaker: LACERIO
line: Well, has you can see, we've got our search ongoing. Divers' down there in shifts. We're quite certain he'll be found.

speaker: MULDER
line: It's been almost eighteen hours, Captain. Where could the body be?

speaker: LACERIO
line: Well, there are cables and debris all over the bottom. It's a painstaking business. Can I ask what the F.B.I.'s interest in this case would be?

speaker: MULDER
line: The suspect matches the description of a federal fugitive.

speaker: LACERIO
line: Really? How's that? No description of the suspect has been released.

speaker: MULDER
line: If you don't mind, can we take a look at the car, please?

speaker: LACERIO
line: It's been taken to impound.

speaker: SCULLY
line: The report says that the car was registered to a rental agency in Gaithersburg. They had no idea that the car was even missing. You know, Mulder, I think that we're wasting our time here.

speaker: MULDER
line: I don't know what the hell I'm supposed to find. You can't make out the license plate in this photo. Hey, Scully, look at this.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What?

speaker: MULDER
line: Look at the car in this photo. Look at the windshield.

speaker: SCULLY
line: It's not the same car.

speaker: SCULLY
line: It's called a caduceus. It's sort of the adopted symbol of the medical profession.

speaker: MULDER
line: So, probably, only a doctor would have that on his car.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mm-hmmm.

speaker: MULDER
line: I had the picture enhanced and the plate is different. "3-A-Y-F."

speaker: SCULLY
line: Fast-forward.

speaker: MULDER
line: That's all you can make out. The rest is obscured. Hey, Danny, it's Mulder. I need you to run a Maryland plate for me. All I got is a partial. Registered to a doctor. Or used to be. Yeah, I'll hold. They switched cars on us, Scully, and they lied about it.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Why would they do that?

speaker: MULDER
line: Maybe the, uh, real owner of the car has got something to hide.

speaker: MULDER
line: Doctor Berube?

speaker: BERUBE
line: Yes?

speaker: MULDER
line: We're with the F.B.I., can we have a minute of your time?

speaker: BERUBE
line: I'm actually very busy.

speaker: MULDER
line: I'm sorry. Are you aware that a car registered to you was involved in a high-speed chase in Arlis yesterday?

speaker: BERUBE
line: Excuse me?

speaker: MULDER
line: A silver Ciera, doctor. Do you own a silver Ciera?

speaker: BERUBE
line: Yes. It was used for what?

speaker: MULDER
line: A crime. Were you aware that it was even missing?

speaker: BERUBE
line: Not until you mentioned it. I have a housekeeper and she often uses the car. It's a second car... Please! They should not be excited. Nothing should be touched.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I'm sorry, I thought they were friendly.

speaker: BERUBE
line: They're part of an experiment.

speaker: MULDER
line: What kind of experiment?

speaker: BERUBE
line: Am I under some kind of suspicion?

speaker: MULDER
line: No.

speaker: BERUBE
line: Then I think I've answered all your questions. Now, if you'll excuse me, I have more work than time.

speaker: MULDER
line: Thank you. Did he bite you?

speaker: SCULLY
line: No, but he tried to.

speaker: MULDER
line: Well, IT'S ALMOST 5:00. We should check with the doctor's housekeeper about the car while we're out here.

speaker: SCULLY
line: No.

speaker: MULDER
line: "No?" What do you mean, "no?"

speaker: SCULLY
line: I mean, this has reached the point of absurdity, Mulder. We're out here on half a hunch off of a cryptic phone call chasing down a, a clue that's based on nothing but speculation.

speaker: MULDER
line: Well, that's all we've got.

speaker: SCULLY
line: That's all he's given us. Who is this Deep Throat character? I mean, we don't know anything about him. What his name is, what he does...

speaker: MULDER
line: He's in a delicate position. He has access to information and indiscretion could expose him.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You don't know that this isn't just a game with him. He's toying with you. Rationing out the facts.

speaker: MULDER
line: You think he does it because he gets off on it?

speaker: SCULLY
line: No. I think he does it because you do.

speaker: DEEP THROAT
line: Calling it a night, Mister Mulder?

speaker: MULDER
line: My mother usually likes me home before the street lights come on.

speaker: DEEP THROAT
line: I'm surprised at you.

speaker: MULDER
line: Why?

speaker: DEEP THROAT
line: Your level of commitment seems to have diminished.

speaker: MULDER
line: My level of commitment?

speaker: DEEP THROAT
line: I should have expected that you'd be working through the night trying to put the pieces together.

speaker: MULDER
line: Well, maybe if you'd given me something more to work with.

speaker: DEEP THROAT
line: Under the circumstances, I've given you all I can.

speaker: MULDER
line: A news report?

speaker: DEEP THROAT
line: And where has it led you?

speaker: MULDER
line: Not very far.

speaker: DEEP THROAT
line: It may be further than you realized.

speaker: MULDER
line: You know, from day one, this has always been on your terms. I've gone along. Been the dutiful son. But maybe this time, we can just cut out the Obi-Wan Kenobi crap and you can save me the trouble.

speaker: DEEP THROAT
line: I fear you've become to dependent on me.

speaker: MULDER
line: Let me tell you something. I've got plenty to do without chasing down your vague leads or trying to decode your circular logic. Maybe it's you who's become too dependent on me... on my willingness to play your games.

speaker: DEEP THROAT
line: Mister Mulder?

speaker: MULDER
line: What?

speaker: DEEP THROAT
line: Don't give up on this one. Trust me. You've never been closer.

speaker: MULDER
line: Closer to what?

speaker: BERUBE
line: Hello? Hello? Who's there?

speaker: CREW-CUT MAN
line: Working late tonight, doctor?

speaker: BERUBE
line: What do you want here?

speaker: CREW-CUT MAN
line: He's alive, isn't he? Has he contacted you?

speaker: BERUBE
line: Please. You're going to have to leave. If you're from the F.B.I., I've already answered all your questions!

speaker: CREW-CUT MAN
line: What questions?

speaker: BERUBE
line: I had nothing to say to them. I have nothing to say to you.

speaker: CREW-CUT MAN
line: Where's Doctor Secare?

speaker: BERUBE
line: I don't know what you're talking about. Please. My work is very important. I must get on with my work.

speaker: CREW-CUT MAN
line: I'm afraid... Your work is done.

speaker: MAN #1
line: Anybody see anything?

speaker: MAN #2
line: No.

speaker: SCUBA DIVER
line: Nothing!

speaker: LACERIO
line: That's it. I'm calling it off. Get those guys out of the water.

speaker: OFFICER
line: Yes, sir. Shore to R.C. One, bring it in.

speaker: MAN #1
line: Visibility...

speaker: MAN #2
line: ...been down there for two days. Forget it.

speaker: SCULLY
line: The county sheriff's office is conducting the investigation. On the preliminary reports, it's being listed as a suicide.

speaker: MULDER
line: Suicide?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yeah, they think that for whatever reason, he trashed his lab and then killed himself.

speaker: MULDER
line: How?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, it says he tied one end of a roll of medical gauze around his neck and the other end to this gas outlet. Then he jumped.

speaker: MULDER
line: I don't suppose there were any witnesses?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Nope.

speaker: MULDER
line: The man we met yesterday kept this place like he was waiting for the people from Good Housekeeping to show up. I would have never pegged him as someone to do all this... or a Greg Louganis out the window.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I know, that gauze is troubling.

speaker: MULDER
line: It's a bit too calculated, huh? Almost as if someone wanted to make doubly sure he'd break his neck before he hit the ground. What else do we know about Doctor Berube?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Ummm... "Terrence Allen Berube. Harvard Med., 1974." He was working on the Human Genome Project. Are you familiar with that?

speaker: MULDER
line: Yeah. The mapping of all human genes. Maybe the most ambitious scientific endeavor in the history of mankind.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Right, but there's nothing extraordinary about that. I mean, there were thousands of scientists working on that project.

speaker: MULDER
line: Yeah, but only one who owned a silver Ciera and went bungie-jumping with medical gauze wrapped around his neck.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I'm sorry, Mulder. I'm seeing the pieces but I'm not seeing the connection.

speaker: MULDER
line: Well, maybe that's just it. Maybe we're not seeing it because it can't be seen, not in any obvious way. What do you think this is?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I don't know.

speaker: MULDER
line: Well, can you find out for me?

speaker: SCULLY
line: What are you going to do?

speaker: MULDER
line: I'll see what else I can find out about Doctor Terrance Allen Berube.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Okay, Mulder, but I'm warning you... if this is monkey pee, you're on your own.

speaker: CARPENTER
line: My first impression is it's some kind of bacteria sample. Can I ask you where you got it?

speaker: SCULLY
line: It was recovered at a crime scene.

speaker: CARPENTER
line: Well, we've come a long way from Colonel Mustard in the den with the rope, haven't we?

speaker: SCULLY
line: No, I'm expecting it to turn out to be nothing.

speaker: CARPENTER
line: No... no, you've definitely got something here. Wow... look at this.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What are they?

speaker: CARPENTER
line: Well, they're the size of bacteria but no bacteria I've ever seen.

speaker: SCULLY
line: How do you mean?

speaker: CARPENTER
line: Well, most bacteria are symmetrical and smooth. These are... I don't know. It's strange.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You have no way of identifying them?

speaker: CARPENTER
line: Well, we could do a freeze fracture. Take a thin slice off and see what's going on inside these babies. If you don't mind waiting.

speaker: SCULLY
line: No, no, I'll wait.

speaker: MULDER
line: Hi, Danny. Yeah, it's Mulder again. Look, I got a number this time. 555-2804. Area code 301. I need an address, a name if you can get it for me. All right, I'm at... same prefix... fifteen-seventeen. All right, thanks, Danny. That was fast.

speaker: SECARE
line: Terry? Is that you?

speaker: MULDER
line: Yeah. Who's this?

speaker: SECARE
line: They shot me, Terry. Oh, God. I've been in the water for three days. I'm hurt.

speaker: MULDER
line: Where are you now?

speaker: SECARE
line: I'm at a pay phone.

speaker: MULDER
line: I'm going to pick you up. Where are you?

speaker: SECARE
line: Terry...

speaker: MULDER
line: Hello?

speaker: MAN
line: Are you okay?

speaker: MULDER
line: Are you there? Hello?

speaker: MAN
line: Hello? This man's been hurt here. I, I think he needs medical attention. He's in pretty bad shape...

speaker: MULDER
line: What's the street? What's the street?

speaker: MAN
line: I'm gonna call an ambulance.

speaker: MULDER
line: Sir? Don't hang up.

speaker: DANNY
line: I got it.

speaker: MULDER
line: Hi, Danny. Let me get the address...

speaker: DANNY
line: All right, you ready? Mulder?

speaker: MULDER
line: I'm just writing it down now, go ahead.

speaker: DANNY
line: All right, the number belongs to a company called Zeus Storage.

speaker: MULDER
line: Yeah...

speaker: DANNY
line: Sixteen-sixteen...

speaker: MULDER
line: Sixteen...

speaker: DANNY
line: Pandora Street.

speaker: MULDER
line: Sixteen... Pandora Street.

speaker: DANNY
line: That's it.

speaker: MULDER
line: All right, thanks.

speaker: MAN
line: All right, we've got a white male, forty, weak vitals and signs of severe dysnea and hypertension. He also has what appears to be a green fluid coming from a wound in his right upper quadrant.

speaker: MAN AT HOSPITAL
line: I don't know what the hell that is. Is he responding to ventilation?

speaker: MAN
line: No and we're noticing those rope veins at the neck and a hypersonant sounding chest. He's going real blue on us now.

speaker: MAN AT HOSPITAL
line: Okay, you've got a tension to a thorax. I want you to perform a thorachotomy and release the pressure in his chest.

speaker: MAN
line: Okay, we're going to need a cannula. We're going to do a needle decompression.

speaker: MAN AT HOSPITAL
line: Mobile van, what's going on? Mobile van, can you hear me? Mobile van, answer me! Mobile van, what is the problem? Mobile van, come in please!

speaker: MULDER
line: Mulder.

speaker: SCULLY
line: It's me.

speaker: MULDER
line: He's alive, Scully.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Who?

speaker: MULDER
line: The fugitive, the driver of the silver Ciera. He called the doctor's house while I was there.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Where is he now?

speaker: MULDER
line: I don't know. Where are you?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I'm at the Georgetown Microbiology Department. I've got something for you.

speaker: MULDER
line: Is it smaller than a silver Ciera?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Much. And it's not silver, it's green.

speaker: MULDER
line: What is it?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Some kind of bacteria, each containing virus and it looks as if Berube may have been cloning them. They also contain something that looks like chloroplasts... Plant cells. But they, they've never seen anything like it here.

speaker: MULDER
line: Any idea what he could have been doing with them?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, the only reason why you clone a virus inside a bacteria......is in order to inject it into something living. It's called gene therapy and it's still highly experimental.

speaker: MULDER
line: Well, maybe that's what he was doing with those monkeys. Can they tell you anything else there?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yeah, they're just about to run some primary cell cultures and a DNA sequence. Now, I may be understating the strangeness of this, Mulder. Bacteria like this... it may have existed, but not for millions of years, not since before our ancestors first crawled out of the sea. Are you there, Mulder? Mulder?

speaker: MULDER
line: Yeah, Scully. Keep up the good work.

speaker: CARPENTER
line: Agent Scully?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Oh, Doctor Carpenter. I fell asleep.

speaker: CARPENTER
line: I've done some work. These are the DNA sequences from the bacteria sample you brought in. You seem to know something about molecular biology. Do you know what you're looking at?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yeah, I think those are genes.

speaker: CARPENTER
line: Right. They're called base pairs. Each pair is made up of something called a nucleotide. Only four nucleotides exist in DNA. Four. And through some miracle of design that we have yet to fathom, every living thing is created out of these four basic building blocks. What you're looking at is a sequence of genes from the bacteria sample. Normally, we'd find no gaps in the sequence. But with these bacteria, we do.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Why is that?

speaker: CARPENTER
line: I don't know why. But I tell you, under any other circumstances, my first call would have been to the government.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What exactly did you find?

speaker: CARPENTER
line: A fifth and sixth DNA nucleotide. A new base pair. Agent Scully, what are you looking at... it exists nowhere in nature. IT would have to be, by definition... extraterrestrial.

speaker: MULDER
line: Hello.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder? Where on God's earth have you been? I've been trying to call you all night.

speaker: MULDER
line: I had a situation. I left my phone in the car.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder... that bacteria I had analyzed... they're saying that it doesn't exist in nature. They're saying that it could be extraterrestrial.

speaker: MULDER
line: Scully...

speaker: SCULLY
line: What?

speaker: MULDER
line: How soon can you be here? There's something I got to show you.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Wait a second... Mulder? I, I just want to say that I was wrong.

speaker: MULDER
line: It's all right, don't worry about it.

speaker: SCULLY
line: No, um... if you'd had listened to me, we wouldn't be here right now. I should know by now to trust your instincts.

speaker: MULDER
line: Why? Nobody else does.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You know, I've always held science as sacred. I've, I've always put my trust in the accepted facts. And what I saw last night... for the first time in my life, I don't know what to believe.

speaker: MULDER
line: Well, whatever it is you do believe, Scully... when you walk into that room? Nothing sacred will hold. There were tanks here and five bodies suspended in solution. There were computers monitoring them. They were alive, Scully, underwater.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What happened to them?

speaker: DEEP THROAT
line: God only knows. Most likely, they've been destroyed. Miss Scully. I believe we met ever so briefly.

speaker: MULDER
line: Destroyed by whom?

speaker: DEEP THROAT
line: I don't know.

speaker: MULDER
line: I don't believe you.

speaker: DEEP THROAT
line: There are limits to my knowledge, Mister Mulder. Inside the intelligence community, there are so-called "black organizations." Groups within groups conducting covert activities, unknown at the highest levels of power.

speaker: MULDER
line: There were three men last night, I was chased.

speaker: DEEP THROAT
line: Hmmm. If you were chased, you would have been killed. Those men are trained for that sort of business and they are trained well.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Were those the same men who killed Doctor Berube?

speaker: DEEP THROAT
line: Presumably.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Why?

speaker: DEEP THROAT
line: "Why?" Good lord, you've worked so hard and you still don't see it.

speaker: MULDER
line: Doctor Berube was conducting human experiments with extraterrestrial viruses.

speaker: DEEP THROAT
line: Yes, but that's been going on for years. We've had the tissue since 1947 but not the technology.

speaker: MULDER
line: Roswell?

speaker: DEEP THROAT
line: Roswell was a smoke screen, we've had a half-a-dozen better salvage operations. Doctor Berube was killed because his work was too successful. You're standing in the room where the first DNA transplant took, the first human-alien hybrid was created. Six volunteer patients, all terminally ill. One, Doctor William Secare, an old friend of Doctor Berube's, was dying of melanoma cancer. And as a result of the E.T. gene therapy, all six patients treated in this room began to recover from their illnesses. Doctor Secare was able to live a more or less normal life. As normal as possible for a man who has developed inhuman strength and the ability to breathe underwater.

speaker: MULDER
line: That's how he was able to elude capture.

speaker: DEEP THROAT
line: Hmmm.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What was he running from?

speaker: DEEP THROAT
line: Doctor Secare was never supposed to have survived. Doctor Berube's research was part of a top secret government project being run out of Los Alamos. All they were interested in was the technology, the science. To have a hybrid living out in the real world? Too great a liability. What if he should need emergency medical procedure? The man has a blood chemistry that is alien and very likely toxic. That story should hit the press.

speaker: MULDER
line: It was just easier to kill Doctor Secare.

speaker: DEEP THROAT
line: Of course, there was only one problem. He was Doctor Berube's old friend and he was able to warn him.

speaker: SCULLY
line: There's just one thing I don't understand. Why you gave us so little to go on in the beginning and why are you giving us so much now?

speaker: DEEP THROAT
line: I didn't anticipate the speed and precision of their clean-up operation. They're systematically destroying all the evidence... Doctor Berube, the bodies here. Without the evidence, you two have no case. Who would believe the story I just told you? You must put together everything that you have found and you must find Doctor Secare before they do. I'll have no further contact with you on this matter.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I'm going to get back to Georgetown and get all the lab work.

speaker: MULDER
line: I'm going to find Doctor Secare.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Where?

speaker: MULDER
line: I don't know. I'm going to trust my instincts.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Excuse me? I'm looking for Doctor Ann Carpenter. I've been unable to reach her by phone and she's not in her office.

speaker: WOMAN
line: She was in a terrible car accident, her whole family. And Doctor Carpenter is, um... dead.

speaker: MULDER
line: Doctor Secare? Wait! I'll protect you.

speaker: CREW-CUT MAN
line: Your cellular phone's been ringing off the hook.

speaker: MULDER
line: I'm a popular guy. Why don't you answer it for me?

speaker: CREW-CUT MAN
line: Oh, I don't like talking on the phone. I have this thing about unsecured lines. When you feel like talking, let me know, though.

speaker: DEEP THROAT
line: He's not home.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Where is he? He's been gone all night.

speaker: DEEP THROAT
line: I wish I knew.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Something's happened to him.

speaker: DEEP THROAT
line: They won't kill him.

speaker: SCULLY
line: How do you know that?

speaker: DEEP THROAT
line: He's become too high-profile and you've got evidence that could expose them.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I don't have any evidence. They took the evidence and they may have killed in order to get it.

speaker: DEEP THROAT
line: Listen to me. Evidence still exists.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Where?

speaker: DEEP THROAT
line: It might be difficult to obtain but with your medical background, I might be able to get you inside.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Inside where?

speaker: DEEP THROAT
line: The high containment facility at Fort Marlene, Maryland.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What do they have there?

speaker: DEEP THROAT
line: The wellspring, Miss Scully. The original tissue. If they've got Agent Mulder, they might be willing to make a deal. It could save his life.

speaker: GUARD
line: Clear.

speaker: GUARD
line: Name?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Dana Scully.

speaker: GUARD
line: Company or institution?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Federal government.

speaker: GUARD
line: Project password? Project password?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Purity control.

speaker: GUARD
line: Log in, please?

speaker: SCULLY
line: You're late.

speaker: DEEP THROAT
line: Do you have it?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yes.

speaker: DEEP THROAT
line: Good. They're willing to make the exchange.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You spoke to them?

speaker: DEEP THROAT
line: Yes. I'll take the parcel.

speaker: SCULLY
line: No, sir. I'll make the exchange.

speaker: DEEP THROAT
line: I made the deal, Scully, they're expecting me.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I don't trust you.

speaker: DEEP THROAT
line: You've got no one else to trust.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I don't know who you are. I know nothing about you.

speaker: DEEP THROAT
line: Oh, for God's sake, don't screw this up! Let me tell you something you should know. In 1987, a group of children from a southern state were given what their parents thought was a routine inoculation. What they were injected with was a clone DNA from the contents of that package you're holding as a test. That's the kind of people you're dealing with!

speaker: SCULLY
line: So why give it back to them?

speaker: DEEP THROAT
line: To save Mulder's life.

speaker: SCULLY
line: At the risk of so many other lives?

speaker: DEEP THROAT
line: Oh, it's the tip of the iceberg. You and Mulder are the only ones who can bring it to light. Now, give me the parcel. Give me the parcel, Scully.

speaker: SCULLY
line: No! Mulder. Mulder!

speaker: DEEP THROAT
line: Trust... Trust... no one.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Hello?

speaker: MULDER
line: Hey, Scully. It's me.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Where are you? They're shutting us down, Scully.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What?

speaker: MULDER
line: They called me in tonight......and they said they're going to reassign us to other sections.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Who said that?

speaker: MULDER
line: Skinner. He said word came down from the top......of the executive branch.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder...

speaker: MULDER
line: It's over, Scully.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, you have to lodge a protest. They can't...

speaker: MULDER
line: Yes, they can.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What are you going to do?

speaker: MULDER
line: I'm... not going to give up. I can't give up. Not as long as the truth is out there.
